intro: Cheiloclinium obtusum, commonly known as the blunt-leaved thornbush, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, clustered in inflorescences at the base of the leaves. Cheiloclinium obtusum is adapted to grow in dry, often disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
